alert.note: Alert for Eastern Union; Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:52AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT HUDSON...SOUTHEASTERN UNION... QUEENS...BRONX...RICHMOND...KINGS...NEW YORK (MANHATTAN) AND WEST CENTRAL NASSAU COUNTIES THROUGH 545 AM EDT... At 452 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Huguenot, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jersey City, Jamaica, Flatbush, Flushing, Bayonne, Mott Haven, Hoboken, East Tremont, Linden, Coney Island, Garden City, Mineola, Todt Hill, Great Neck, and Crown Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
